intro: Garnotia triseta, commonly known as the three-branched garnet, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, round, red fruits that resemble garnets, giving it its common name. Garnotia triseta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical studies.
